question.title: Why is my spring response not formatted with my gson configuration?
question.body:
I can successful map incoming JSON "tls-alias" to Java String "tlsAlias". But the response does not follow my naming policy. It returns "tlsAlias" instead of "tls-alias".

The Content-Type returned is "application/json;charset=UTF-8", so definitely converts to JSON.

Is there a different setting I have to use?

application.yml

spring:
  mvc.converters.preferred-json-mapper: gson
  gson.field-naming-policy: LOWER_CASE_WITH_DASHES

My exception handler:

@RestControllerAdvice
public class ValidationExceptionHandler {
    // handle @Valid exceptions
    @ExceptionHandler(MethodArgumentNotValidException.class)
    public ResponseEntity<MyValidationErrorResponse> handleValidationExceptions(
            MethodArgumentNotValidException ex) {
        // collect all errors in a map
        List<FieldError> errors = ex.getBindingResult().getFieldErrors();
        Map<String, List<String>> errorDetail = new HashMap<>();
        errors.forEach(error ->
            errorDetail.computeIfAbsent(error.getField(), k -> new java.util.ArrayList<>()).add(error.getDefaultMessage())
        );

        var errorResponse = new MyValidationErrorResponse(errorDetail);
        return new ResponseEntity<>(errorResponse, HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST);
    }
}

answers.body:
I had two problems:

  1. Duplicate Gson configuration (code + yml)... this fixed the Map name.

  2. The keys of the map are used as-is, because Gson formats only fields.
    My solution was to copy the code that formats the field names and use it before inserting into the Map.
